update.description:
This class takes in a google protobuf message and generates widgets for configuring its properties.

This is going to be used by the model editor

* For some message types: geometry, pose, vector3, color - a custom widget is created as opposed to generating a widget for each individual field mainly for aesthetics

* TODOs: parsing and generating widgets for repeated fields, and enum fields.
update.title: Add new ConfigWidget class

content.raw: Not show what's the best way to show this but I created a [configwidget_test](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/b47f1337f62f6eb4d542c466f774277c582ff5fe) branch to show how a user would use this widget. Launch gazebo in this branch and a tab widget should pop up with a few ConfigWidgets embeded in it.
content.html: Not show what's the best way to show this but I created a configwidget_test branch to show how a user would use this widget. Launch gazebo in this branch and a tab widget should pop up with a few ConfigWidgets embeded in it.

content.raw:
Great suggestions. I addressed a few of them in aaf75b2.

* added more indentation

* removed column `:` after field names

* changed spacing between label and widgets for color and vector3 fields.

About other comments:

* For fields that shouldn't exist or be editable: I wanted to keep the ConfigWidget generic and simple, and later on I intend to add functions to enable users of this widget to change the visibility of fields

* Widget doesn't fit in screen: same reasoning as before - keeping the widget simple. Users of this class can create a QScrollArea and embed this widget in it.

* Quaternions vs RPY: We can add this option, but I think RPY is generally easier to interpret by users and it's also consistent with SDF. 

* Alternating background and collapse icon on the button: I will tackle this in later pull requests.

* Add units beside widgets. Let's address this issue separately. We can update other ui widgets together in another pull request.
content.html:
Great suggestions. I addressed a few of them in aaf75b2.

  • added more indentation

  • removed column : after field names

  • changed spacing between label and widgets for color and vector3 fields.

About other comments:

  • For fields that shouldn't exist or be editable: I wanted to keep the ConfigWidget generic and simple, and later on I intend to add functions to enable users of this widget to change the visibility of fields

  • Widget doesn't fit in screen: same reasoning as before - keeping the widget simple. Users of this class can create a QScrollArea and embed this widget in it.

  • Quaternions vs RPY: We can add this option, but I think RPY is generally easier to interpret by users and it's also consistent with SDF.

  • Alternating background and collapse icon on the button: I will tackle this in later pull requests.

  • Add units beside widgets. Let's address this issue separately. We can update other ui widgets together in another pull request.

content.raw: yep good optimization, done in aaf75b2
content.html: yep good optimization, done in aaf75b2

content.raw: I updated doxygen description on `_name` in aaf75b2. It's actually used internally to recursively build the scoped name of the widget. So the first call of the function, it'll be an empty string.
content.html: I updated doxygen description on _name in aaf75b2. It's actually used internally to recursively build the scoped name of the widget. So the first call of the function, it'll be an empty string.

update.title: Add new ConfigWidget class

content.raw: What is the best way to bring up this widget?
content.html: What is the best way to bring up this widget?

Only update if you feel like it:

std::map <std::string, ConfigChildWidget *>::iterator iter = this->configWidget.find(_name);

if (iter != this->configWidgets.end())
  this->UpdateIntWidget(iter->second, _value);

This could be applied to following functions as well.

update.title: Add new ConfigWidget class

content.raw:
Cool, that's practical :D I played around with some message types, see screen-shots below.

A few comments:

* It's a bit difficult sometimes to tell what property belongs to what. For example, for the visual's `material->script->name`, there's only a small indentation differing it from `material->normal_map`; the link's `inertial->pose->roll` is aligned with `inertial->ixx`... Maybe increasing indentation or adding some branch-like images (![stylesheet-branch-more.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3780374994-stylesheet-branch-more.png)) could help?  I was also not sure what the buttons would do until I clicked on them. Maybe some triangles like those on the `ModelListWidget` (![stylesheet-branch-closed.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/894753431-stylesheet-branch-closed.png)) could indicate whether the group is collapsed or not. I'm not sure how practical or desirable it would be to implement something like a [QTreeView](http://qt-project.org/doc/qt-4.8/stylesheet-examples.html#customizing-qtreeview), just brainstorming here :) I can aid implementing these changes :)

* The visual widget didn't fit into my screen, as you can see in the screenshot, but I guess this can be solved adding a scroll-bar to the parent widget. I wonder if it would be best to start with all properties collapsed though.

* Some fields are editable and I'm not sure if they should be. Actually, not sure if some of them must even be there, like `id`.

* Talking about fields that shouldn't be there, it seems like the `axis2` for joints will show up even for joints which don't have it...

* Maybe color every second line's background differently so it's easier to tell them apart? (like on `ModelListWidget`)

* Only some fields like `RGB`, `RPY` and `xyz` have a colon (:) after the property name, maybe add colons to all properties or remove from these

* Option to edit quaternions instead of RPY?

* Add units, like `m`, `rad`? (Actually I think this would be nice on  `ModelListWidget` too)

* Not sure exactly what would be best, but the alignment feels a bit weird in some places, like for `RGB`, `r`'s box ends up much closer to `g`...

Let me know what you think and whether I can assist with anything ;)

### Link: ###

### Visual: ###

### Collision: ###
![configwidget4.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2942344896-configwidget4.png)
content.html:
Cool, that's practical :D I played around with some message types, see screen-shots below.

A few comments:

  • It's a bit difficult sometimes to tell what property belongs to what. For example, for the visual's material->script->name, there's only a small indentation differing it from material->normal_map; the link's inertial->pose->roll is aligned with inertial->ixx... Maybe increasing indentation or adding some branch-like images () could help? I was also not sure what the buttons would do until I clicked on them. Maybe some triangles like those on the ModelListWidget () could indicate whether the group is collapsed or not. I'm not sure how practical or desirable it would be to implement something like a QTreeView, just brainstorming here :) I can aid implementing these changes :)

  • The visual widget didn't fit into my screen, as you can see in the screenshot, but I guess this can be solved adding a scroll-bar to the parent widget. I wonder if it would be best to start with all properties collapsed though.

  • Some fields are editable and I'm not sure if they should be. Actually, not sure if some of them must even be there, like id.

  • Talking about fields that shouldn't be there, it seems like the axis2 for joints will show up even for joints which don't have it...

  • Maybe color every second line's background differently so it's easier to tell them apart? (like on ModelListWidget)

  • Only some fields like RGB, RPY and xyz have a colon (:) after the property name, maybe add colons to all properties or remove from these

  • Option to edit quaternions instead of RPY?

  • Add units, like m, rad? (Actually I think this would be nice on ModelListWidget too)

  • Not sure exactly what would be best, but the alignment feels a bit weird in some places, like for RGB, r's box ends up much closer to g...

Let me know what you think and whether I can assist with anything ;)
